choices.name: Get started with research for your New York ancestors.

hidden.content:
• Learn successful research strategies for New York ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Selection Table to determine priorities for New York research.

content.text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic New York research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic New York Research Tips and Strategies
    RT—New York Research Essentials—61:07



  2. Learn more about New York state research.

    ☆ RT—Five Things You Need to Know about New York State—13:05



    ☆ AA—New York State Research

  3. Follow this research study for New York ancestors, from 1880 to the present.

    ☆ FS—Step-by-Step New York Research, 1880-Present

  4. Ancestry: Explore resources for New York research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—New York Resources
    ☆ AC—New York State Research Guide, 5 pgs.

  5. Explore online databases and sites for New York research.

    ☆ TH—New York Genealogy Online
    ☆ RT—New York State Online Records: Overview—11:19


  6. Record Finder: Use the New York Record Selection Table to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—New York Record Selection Table

    7. Additional Records
    1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
    3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
    4. Learn about research in colonial New York.

      ☆ AC—Colonial New York

    5. Follow these case studies for New York research.

      ☆ LDS—Finding the burial location of an immigrant from Ireland who died in New York
      ☆ LDS—Finding the family of an Irish family with common names living in New York City


    Ethnic
    1. African American: Learn about African Americans in New York in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for New York

    2. Learn more about African American records.

      ☆ AG—New York African American Records

    3. Explore the African American Gateway for New York.
    4. Native American: Learn about American Indians in New York in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of New York


Additional Records
  1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
  3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
  4. Learn about research in colonial New York.

    ☆ AC—Colonial New York

  5. Follow these case studies for New York research.

    ☆ LDS—Finding the burial location of an immigrant from Ireland who died in New York
    ☆ LDS—Finding the family of an Irish family with common names living in New York City

Ethnic
  1. African American: Learn about African Americans in New York in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for New York

  2. Learn more about African American records.

    ☆ AG—New York African American Records

  3. Explore the African American Gateway for New York.
  4. Native American: Learn about American Indians in New York in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of New York

choices.name: Learn about New York archives and libraries.

hidden.content:
• Explore statewide and regional collections.
  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about New York archives and libraries in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: New York Archives and Libraries
    ☆ New_York State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research

  2. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for New York.
  3. Explore the New York State Archives site.
  4. Explore New York State Archives collection.
  5. Explore the ☆Books We Own site for New York genealogy publications. Volunteers may be available for lookup services.

hidden.content:
• Explore city and county directories to find New York ancestors.
  • Discover the different types of information in directories, such as streets, churches, historical info, etc.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for city directories. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about New York city directories in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: New York Directories

  2. Sites: Explore New York city directories on the Ancestor Hunt site.
  3. Find out more about city directories in this research guide from Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Six Things to Find—3 pgs.

  4. Explore New York city directories on the ☆Ancestry site.
  5. Explore New York ☆historical directories by county.
  6. Explore additional links for New York city directories on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.

choices.name: Learn about New York vital records.

hidden.content:
• Find online resources for vital records.
  • Learn the history of vital records in the state of New York.
  • Learn about alternates for vital records in New York.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for vital records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about New York vital records in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: New York Vital Records
    ☆ AC—Wiki: New_York Vital Records

  2. Learn about challenges in working with New York vital records and how to find record susbtitutes.

    ☆ Finding New York Birth, Marriage, and Death Records

  3. Explore links for vital records on the New York Public Health site.
  4. Search for online New York ☆vital records and find addresses for state offices to write to for records.
  5. Explore New York birth, marriage, and death records on the ☆AccessGenealogy site.
  6. Explore links for New York town records on the American Ancestors site.
  7. Explore additional links for New York vital records on the ☆Linkpendium site and the Genealogy Branches site.

hidden.content: • Find birth and adoption records for New York ancestors.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for birth and adoption records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn how to find New York birth records in this article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: How to Find New York Birth Records

  2. Learn about accessing geographic birth records for New York City.

    ☆ OT—Introducing the Free New York City Geographic Birth Index

  3. Explore New York City birth records on the ItalianGen site.
  4. Explore additional links for New York birth records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  5. Get help with adoption topics on the New York Adoptees Facebook page.

QUIKLinks

choices.name: Explore New York marriage and divorce records.

hidden.content: • Find marriage and divorce records for New York ancestors.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for marriage and divorce records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Here are some essential steps in finding marriage records in New York.

    ☆ Essential Steps to Find a New York State Marriage Record

  2. Learn how to find New York marriage records with FamilySearch.
  3. Explore links for New York marriage records.
  4. Explore the New York City Brides Record Index and the New York City Grooms Record Indexon the ItalianGen site.
  5. Explore additional links for New York marriage records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  6. Learn about divorce records in New York.

    ☆ New York Divorce Records for Genealogy Research

QUIKLinks

choices.name: Explore New York obituaries and death records.

hidden.content:
• Find obituaries for New York ancestors.
  • Find death records and death indexes for New York ancestors.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for obituary and death records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Explore the ObituariesHelp site for New York obituaries.
  2. Explore The Ancestor Hunt for obituaries.
  3. Search for obituaries by county on the Newspaperobituaries.net site.
  4. Find additional resources for New York obituaries on the ☆Linkpendium site.
New York Death Records
  1. Learn how to find New York death records in this article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: How to Find New York Death Records

  2. Learn about the importance of death certificates in New York research.

    ☆ FS—Why you need to have your ancestor's New York death certificate

  3. Explore the Ancestors at Rest site for New York death records.
  4. Explore New York death records, indexes, and obituaries.
  5. Explore New York City Municipal records on the ItalianGen site to find death information.
  6. Explore additional links for New York death records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.

QUIKLinks

choices.name: Explore New York census and voter records.

hidden.content:
• Explore state and county census records for New York ancestors.
  • Find voter registration records in New York.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for census and voter records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Get an overview of New York censuses in these articles.

    ☆ FS—New York Census
    ☆ AC—New_York Census Records

  2. Learn more about New York state census records.

    ☆ New York State Census Records Online

  3. Learn how to use New York state census records on Archives.com.

    ☆ AR—Using the New York State Census on Archives.com



  4. Learn about New York resources that can compensate for missing 1890 Census records.

    ☆ New York State Substitutes for the Lost 1890 Census

  5. Explore the MyFreeCensus site for New York state and county census records.
  6. Explore additional links for New York census records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  7. Explore New York census records on the ☆AccessGenealogy site and theGenealogy Branches site.
Voting Registers
  1. Learn about New York voting registers in these articles.

    ☆ FS—New York Voting Registers

  2. Explore New York voter records on the Steven Morse site.

content.text:
1. Get an overview of New York church records in these articles.

    ☆ FS—New York Church Records
    ☆ AC—New York Church Records

  2. Learn how to find and use religious records in the state of New York.

    ☆ RT—New York State Religious Records—9:00


  3. Learn about searching religious record collections on the New York Genealogical and Biographical Society site.

    ☆ Using the NYG&B's Religious Records Collection

  4. Learn how to find Catholic Church records in New York.

    ☆ New York Catholic Records Online

  5. Explore additional links for New York church records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  6. Explore church record resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

content.text:

    ☆ FS—New York Cemetery Records

  2. Browse the ☆Interment.net site for New York cemetery records.
  3. Search for New York cemetery records online.
  4. Explore New York cemetery records on the ☆AccessGenealogy site.
  5. Explore additional links for New York cemetery records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  6. Explore the ☆Tombstone Transcription Project on the U.S. GenWeb site.
  7. Search the ☆Find A Grave site for cemetery records.
  8. Search the ☆BillionGraves site for cemetery records.
  9. Explore ☆African American cemetery records in New York.

  • Find migration and travel routes for New York ancestors.

  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:

    ☆ FS—Wiki: New York Emigration and Immigration

  2. Learn about New York migration routes.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: New York Migration
    ☆ RT—Tracing Migrations from New York: 1780 to 1880—17:32



  3. Learn about finding New York immigration records online.

    ☆ New York Immigration Records Online

  4. Here are some tips for finding immigrant ancestors who came through New York.

    ☆ Tips for Finding Your Immigrant Ancestors

  5. Explore additional links for New York immigration records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
Passenger Lists and Naturalization
  1. Download passenger list immigration forms (scroll down to the National Archives and Record Administration section).
  2. Explore early passenger lists to New Netherlands on the ☆Olive Tree Genealogy site.
  3. Learn about finding New York naturalization records online.

    ☆ New York Naturalization Records Online

  4. Explore naturalization resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
  5. Explore naturalization records from the NARA on the ItalianGen site.

QUIKLinks

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks (lightning bolts) or New York County links (bottom) to quickly search common record collections for New York.

content.text:
Note : To search records on these sites, you must be registered on the site or be at a FamilySearch Center.

  1. In the QUIKLinks, click the link for FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast, or MyHeritage to view the corresponding record collection.
  2. Scroll down near the bottom of this page to see available county records. Click the name of the county for FamilySearch, or A for Ancestry, or L for Linkpendium.

1. In FamilySearch, explore the New York Online Genealogy Records page for a variety of record collections.
  2. In each program (FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.
  3. Learn about additional sites to search for New York records.

    ☆ RT—Finding New York Records Online—22:34

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

content.text:
1. Visit the New York Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the New York Genealogy page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the New York Genealogical and Biographical Society page on Facebook.
  4. Visit the U.S. Northeast Genealogy Research page on Facebook.
  5. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for New York.

Regional Groups

1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about New York research.
  2. Explore the New York research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Explore the ☆FamilySearch community for help with New York research.
  4. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about New York research.
  5. Explore New York research questions in the ☆Genealogy Stack Exchange.
  6. Explore New York City research questions in the ☆Genealogy Stack Exchange.

choices.name: Learn about New York genealogy societies.

hidden.content: • * Proficient: Make a list of Facebook groups, mailing lists, and genealogy societies of interest, and then join or subscribe to them.

content.text:
1. Learn about genealogy societies in New York in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: New York Societies

  2. Explore the New York Genealogical and Biographical Society site.
  3. Learn more about the New York Genealogical and Biographical Society.

    ☆ FS—Finding New York Ancestors—The New York Genealogical and Biographical Society

  4. Explore the Central New York Genealogical Society site.
  5. Explore New York genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.
  6. Get help at a family history center in New York.
